net.sf.opengroove.client.com
Interface ImmediateMessageListener

public interface ImmediateMessageListener

Implementations of this class can be added to a CommandCommunicator, and will be notified when an immediate message is received.

Author:
Alexander Boyd

Method Summary
 void receive(String id, String username, String computer, byte[] message)
          Indicates to this listener that an immediate message has been received.
 

Method Detail

receive

void receive(String id,
             String username,
             String computer,
             byte[] message)
Indicates to this listener that an immediate message has been received. This is usually called in a new thread, so there is no need for this method to complete processing quickly.

Parameters:
id - the id of the message received, as specified by the sender of the message.
username - The username or userid of the user that sent the message.
computer - The name of the computer that sent the message, or the empty string if the computer is not known
message - The actual message itself. The array is generally shared between all ImmediateMessageListeners notified of the message, so the contents of this array should not be modified. If modification is necessary, the array should be copied, using a method such as System.arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int).
